intro: Drymonia dodsonii, commonly known as the Dodson's drymonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
